snippet: The movement of the 15 men from Djibouti to the Seychelles was a welcome development for the United States in a high-profile case with no clear legal resolution.
abstract: Fifteen Somali men accused of being pirates, who were captured aboard a hijacked Iranian fishing vessel by the United States Navy, are transferred from Djibouti to the island nation of the Seychelles for trial; move is a welcome development for the United States in a high-profile case that has had no clear legal resolution, and which spawned an intensive interagency effort to find a jurisdiction willing to receive the suspects.
lead_paragraph: The movement of the 15 men from Djibouti to the Seychelles was a welcome development for the United States in a high-profile case with no clear legal resolution.

headline.seo: Somalis on Iranian Ship Face Piracy Charges in Seychelles
headline.main: Somali Suspects in Hijacking of Iranian Ship Face Piracy Trial in Seychelles
headline.print_headline: Somali Suspects in Hijacking of Iranian Ship Face Piracy Trial in Seychelles
